metadata.title: CVE-2021-29969 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
If Thunderbird was configured to use STARTTLS for an IMAP connection, andan attacker injected IMAP server responses prior to the completion of theSTARTTLS handshake, then Thunderbird didn't ignore the injected data. Thiscould have resulted in Thunderbird showing incorrect information, forexample the attacker could have tricked Thunderbird to show folders thatdidn't exist on the IMAP server. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird <78.12.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29969` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
